sen.j: 八条宮智忠親王（はちじょうのみや としただしんのう、元和 6年11月1日（1620年11月24日） - 寛文2年7月7日（1662年8月20日）は、江戸時代前期の日本の皇族。
sen.e: Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshitada (November 24, 1620 - August 20, 1662) was a member of Japanese imperial family who lived in the early Edo period.
Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshitada (November 24, 1620 - August 20, 1662) was a member of the Japanese imperial family who lived in the early Edo period.
Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshitada (November 24, 1620 - August 20, 1662) was a member of the Japanese Imperial Family who lived in the early Edo period.
He was the second head of the Hachijonomiya (Katsuranomiya) family.
He was the second head of the Hachijonomiya (Katsuranomiya) family.
He was the second head of the Hachijonomiya (Katsuranomiya) family.

sen.j: 八条宮智仁親王第1王子、生母は丹後国主京極高知の娘京極常子。
sen.e: He was the first son of Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshihito and his biological mother was Tsuneko KYOGOKU (京極常子), a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU who was a daimyo of Tango Province.
sen.cmt: 京極常子→Tsuneko KYOGOKU[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: He was the first son of Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshihito and his biological mother was Tsuneko KYOGOKU (京極常子), a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU who was a member of the daimyo of Tango Province.

He was the first son of Hachijonomiya Imperial Prince Toshihito and his biological mother was Tsuneko KYOGOKU, a daughter of Takatomo KYOGOKU who was a member of the daimyo (Japanese feudal lord) of Tango Province.
sen.cmt: (京極常子)削除京極常子→Tsuneko KYOGOKU[正しい読み方が不明です](Japanese feudal lord)補足

sen.j: 幼称は若宮、多古麿（たこまろ）。
sen.e: His childhood name was Wakamiya and Takomaro.
His childhood name was Wakamiya and Takomaro.
His childhood name was Wakamiya and Takomaro.

sen.j: 寛永元年（1624年）後水尾天皇の猶子となり、寛永3年（1626年）12月親王宣下を受け、忠仁（ただひと）と命名される。
sen.e: In 1624, he became a yushi (another child considered as one's own) of Emperor Gomizunoo, then in 1626, he received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince and was named Tadahito.
sen.cmt: 猶子→yushi (another child considered as one's own)[http://tangorin.com/words/猶子]
sen.e: In 1624, he became a yushi (another's child considered as one's own) of Emperor Gomizunoo, then in 1626, he received the Emperor's proclamation for being an Imperial Prince and was named Tadahito.
In 1624, he became a yushi (another's child considered as one's own) of Emperor Gomizunoo, then in 1626, he received the Imperial order for being an Imperial Prince and was named Tadahito.
sen.cmt: Emperor's proclamation→Imperial order 他の記事と合わせる

sen.j: 後に智忠親王と改称する。
sen.e: Later, he changed his name into Imperial Prince Toshitada.
Later, he changed his name to Imperial Prince Toshitada.
Later, he changed his name to Imperial Prince Toshitada.

sen.j: 寛永6年（1629年）2月元服して、中務省に任じられる。
sen.e: In February 1629, he went through genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) and assigned to serve Nakatsukasa sho (Ministry of Central Affairs).
sen.cmt: 元服→genpuku (ceremony o f attaining manhood) [http://tangorin.com/words/元服]
sen.e: In February 1629, he went through a genpuku (ceremony for attaining manhood) and was assigned to serve at the Nakatsukasa sho (Ministry of Central Affairs).
In February 1629, he went through a genpuku (ceremony for attaining manhood) and was assigned to serve at the Nakatsukasa sho (Ministry of Central Affairs).

sen.j: 同年4月父智仁親王の薨去により宮家を継承する。
sen.e: In April of the same year, he took over the Miya family due to the death of his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito.
In April of the same year, he took over the Miya family due to the death of his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito.
In April of the same year, he took over Miyake (house of an imperial prince) due to the death of his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito.
sen.cmt: スペース削除"the Miya family" -> "Miyake (house of an imperial prince)" に変更しました。

sen.j: 寛永19年（1642年）9月前田利常の女富子を妃とするが、後嗣を儲けることはできなかったため、承応3年（1654年）後水尾天皇の第13皇子穏仁親王を養子とする。
sen.e: In September 1642, he married Tomiko (富子), a daughter of Toshitsune MAEDA, but they couldn't have the heir, thus he adopted Imperial Prince Yasuhito who was the thirteenth son of Emperor Gomizunoo.
sen.cmt: 富子→Tomiko[正しい読み方が不明です]
sen.e: In September 1642, he married Tomiko (富子), a daughter of Toshitsune MAEDA, but they couldn't produce an heir, so, he adopted Imperial Prince Yasuhito who was the thirteenth son of Emperor Gomizunoo.

In September 1642, he married Tomiko, a daughter of Toshitsune MAEDA, but they couldn't produce an heir, so, he adopted Imperial Prince Yasuhito who was the thirteenth son of Emperor Gomizunoo in 1654.
sen.cmt: (富子)削除富子→Tomiko[正しい読み方が不明です]in 1654補足

sen.j: 明暦3年（1657年）二品に叙せられる。
sen.e: In 1657, he was given the rank of nihon (the second of Imperial Princes' ranks).
In 1657, he was given the rank of nihon (the second of Imperial Princes' ranks).
In 1657, he was given the rank of nihon (the second of Imperial Princes' ranks).
He passed away on July 7, 1662.
He passed away on July 7, 1662.
He passed away on July 7, 1662.
His age at death was 44.
His age at death was 44.
His age at death was 44.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Tenkoin.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Tenkoin.
His homyo (posthumous Buddhist name) was Tenkoin.

sen.j: 智忠親王は、父智仁親王の影響を強く受け、学問を好んだ。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Toshitada was strongly influenced by his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito and liked learning.
Imperial Prince Toshitada was strongly influenced by his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito and liked learning.
Imperial Prince Toshitada was strongly influenced by his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito and liked learning.

sen.j: 和歌、書道に秀でていた。
sen.e: He excelled in waka (classic Japanese poem, often 31 mora) and calligraphy.
sen.cmt: 和歌→waka (classic Japanese poem, often 31 mora)[http://tangorin.com/words/和歌]
sen.e: He excelled in waka (classic Japanese poetry, often 31 mora) and calligraphy.
He excelled in waka (classic Japanese poetry, often 31 mora) and calligraphy.

sen.j: 最大の功績は桂離宮を後世に伝える上で基礎を築いたことである。
sen.e: His best achievement was laying the foundation of passing down Katsura Imperial Villa to posterity.
His best achievement was laying the foundation of passing down Katsura Imperial Villa to posterity.
His best achievement was laying the foundation of passing down Katsura Imperial Villa to posterity.

sen.j: 父智仁親王が造営した桂の別荘（桂離宮）は父の没後、しばらく荒廃していたが、智忠親王はこれを改修し、御殿を増築し、庭園を整備することに努めた。
sen.e: The villa of Katsura (Katsura Imperial Villa) built by his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito had been devastated for a while after he passed away, but Imperial Prince Toshitada renovated it and built out a palace, also tried to maintain the garden.

The villa of Katsura (Katsura Imperial Villa) built by his father, Imperial Prince Toshihito had been devastated for a while after he passed away, but Imperial Prince Toshitada renovated it and built it into a palace, also tried to maintain the garden.

The villa of katsura (Katsura Imperial Villa), which had been built by his father (Imperial Prince Toshihito), was left in ruins for some time after his father's death, but Imperial Prince Toshitada renovated and extended it to convert it into a palace, while also working to maintain the garden.
sen.cmt: 原文に沿うように訳し直しました。
